meanings.definition: To reduce in quantity or exhaust
meanings.sent1: The constant use of water was depleting the well.
meanings.sent2: The company's resources were depleting rapidly due to poor management.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner joked that he was depleting the snack supply at the finish line.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was depleting like a sinking ship taking on water.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was depleting the forest, leaving behind a barren landscape.

meanings.definition: Becoming less in amount or size
meanings.sent1: The depleting sunlight signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: The depleting funds forced the family to cut back on expenses.
meanings.sent3: The depleting ice cream cone made the child pout.
meanings.sent4: Her depleting patience was like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The depleting crowd at the concert made the venue feel empty.
